sen.j: 座（ざ）は、平安時代から戦国時代 (日本)まで存在した主に商工業者や芸能者による同業者組合のこと。
sen.e: The za, established mainly by merchants, manufacturers and entertainers, refers to the guilds that existed from the Heian period to the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: 原文には、「戦国時代 (日本)」 とありますが、「(日本)」はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「戦国時代」だけとなっており、本来はこちらの用語だけを使用していると思われますので、こちらだけを訳出しました。
sen.e: The za, established mainly by merchants, manufacturers and entertainers, refers to the guilds that existed from the Heian period to the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The za, established mainly by merchants, manufacturers and entertainers, refers to the guilds that existed from the Heian period to the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 朝廷や貴族・寺社などに金銭などを払う代わりに営業や販売の独占権などの特権を認められた。
sen.e: These guilds were granted the privilege of exclusive rights to business and sales in exchange for offering money to the Imperial Court, nobles, temples, and shrines.
These guilds were granted the privilege of exclusive rights to business and sales in exchange for offering money to the Imperial Court, nobles, temples, and shrines.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: These guilds were granted the privilege of exclusive rights to market and sell in exchange for payment to the Imperial Court, nobles, temples, and/or shrines.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 座という呼び名の由来については、公的な場所や市場内における特定の座席という意味に由来するとする説と同業者による集会の場という意味に由来するとする説の2説がある。
sen.e: There were two theories about the origin of the name za: one argued that the name originated from the idea of the specific seats in official places or marketplaces, and the other maintained that it came from the idea of the meeting place for the same profession.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There were two theories about the origin of the name za: one argued that the name originated from the idea of the specific seats in official places or marketplaces, and the other maintained that it came from the idea of the meeting place for the same profession.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: There are two theories about the origin of the name za: one argues that the name originated from a word which represented a specific seat in an official place or a marketplace, and the other maintains that it came from a word which meant meeting place for people in the same industry.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: これらは、長年議論の対象となってきた（「座論争」）が、今日では座とは本来は一定の有資格者が一同に会する場を指し、両方の意味合いを有していたとする説が有力である。
sen.e: These theories have been discussed over a long period of time (the za debate), and the current theory generally holds that the za originally indicated to the place where certain qualified persons gathered all together and thus included the meaning of the previous two theories.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These theories have been discussed over a long period of time (the za debate), and the current theory generally holds that the za originally indicated to the place where certain qualified persons gathered all together and thus included the meaning of the previous two theories.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: These theories have been discussed over a long period of time (this discussion is called 'the za debate'), and the current dominant theory explains that the word "za" originally indicated a place where certain qualified persons gathered all together and thus the word included both the meanings.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: また、地縁的結合をもって結成される場合もあり、「里座」・「町座」と呼ばれる里単位・町単位の座も結成された。
sen.e: The local-based za were sometimes established; as such, the village-based za called 'sato-za' and the town-based za called 'machi-za' were formed.
The local-based za were sometimes established; as such, the village-based za called 'sato-za' and the town-based za called 'machi-za' were formed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Local-based za were sometimes established; for example, village-based za called 'sato-za' and town-based za called 'machi-za' were formed.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 座は公家や寺社を本所として座役を納め、あるいは奉仕を行い、本所は座の構成員である座衆に供御人・寄人・神人などの身分を与えてこれを保護した。
sen.e: The za paid the za-yaku (duties applied to the za) or offered services to court nobles, temples and shrines as their honjo (controller and protector of the za) while the honjo granted the titles such as Kugonin (purveyors to the Imperial household), Yoriudo (dependents of powerful nobles, temples or shrines), and Jinin (associates of Shinto shrines) to the za-shu (members of the za).

The za paid the za-yaku (duties applied to the za) or offered services to court nobles, temples and shrines as their honjo (controller and protector of the za) while the honjo granted the titles such as Kugonin (purveyors to the Imperial household), Yoriudo (dependents of powerful nobles, temples or shrines), and Jinin (associates of Shinto shrines) to the za-shu (members of the za).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: A za did za-yaku (duties imposed on a za) or offered services to a court noble, a temple or a shrine which was their honjo (a controller and protector of a za), and in exchange for it the honjo granted some status such as Kugonin (purveyors to the Imperial Household), Yoriudo (dependents of powerful nobles, temples or shrines), or Jinin (associates of Shinto shrines) to za-shu (members of a za) of that za.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 記録上に残る最古の座は青蓮院を本所とする八瀬里座で杣伐夫や駕輿丁によって構成されて青蓮院の本山である延暦寺や朝廷に奉仕を行い、後の八瀬童子の源流となった。
sen.e: The oldest za on record was the yaseri-za (八瀬里座), which was under the honjo of the Shoren-in Temple and comprised of fellers and palanquin bearers, and the yaseri-za offered services to the Enryaku-ji Temple, the head temple of the Shoren-in Temple, and the Imperial Court, paving the way for the emergence of the later yase-doji (palanquin bearers for the emperor in Yase).
sen.cmt: 八瀬里座→yaseri-za[正しい読み方が不明です]
sen.e: The oldest za on record was the yaseri-za (八瀬里座), which was under the honjo of the Shoren-in Temple and comprised of fellers and palanquin bearers, and the yaseri-za offered services to the Enryaku-ji Temple, the head temple of the Shoren-in Temple, and the Imperial Court, paving the way for the emergence of the later yase-doji (palanquin bearers for the emperor in Yase).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The oldest za on record was the Yaseri-za (written as 八瀬里座 in Japanese), which was under the control of the Shoren-in Temple and comprised of fellers and palanquin bearers, and the Yaseri-za offered services to the Enryaku-ji Temple, which was the head temple of the sect that the Shoren-in Temple belonged to, and the Imperial Court.It eventually became the origin of the later Yase-doji (palanquin bearers for an emperor in Yase).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 鎌倉時代に入ると大都市や商工都市を中心として座の数が増加するようになる。
sen.e: During the Kamakura period, the number of the za increased in big cities and in commercial and industrial cities.
During the Kamakura period, the number of za increased in big cities and in commercial and industrial cities.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Once the Kamakura period began, the number of za increased in big cities and in commercial and industrial cities.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 代表的なものとしては京都においては後の西陣の源流となった大舎人の織手座や祇園社の綿座・錦座、北野社の麹座、山城大山崎の油座、摂津今宮の魚座、鎌倉の材木座、博多の油座などがあった。
sen.e: The major za in Kyoto were the orite-za (guild of weavers) in Otoneri, and the wata-za (cotton guild) and the nishiki-za (brocade guild, 錦座) under the umbrella of the Gion-sha Shrine, all of which were the origins of later Nishijin; there were also the koji-za (rice malt guild) under the Kitano-sha Shrine, the yuza (oil guild) in Oyamazaki, Yamashiro Province, the uo-za (fish guild) in Imamiya, Settsu Province, the zaimoku-za (guild of lumber dealers) in Kamakura; and the yuza (oil guild) in Hakata.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処nishiki-za, kin-za(a guild of silk fabric merchants)→nishiki-za (brocade guild)[正しい読み方が不明です]
sen.e: The major za in Kyoto were the orite-za (guild of weavers) in Otoneri, and the wata-za (cotton guild) and the nishiki-za (brocade guild, 錦座) under the umbrella of the Gion-sha Shrine, all of which were the origins of later Nishijin; there were also the koji-za (rice malt guild) under the Kitano-sha Shrine, the yuza (oil guild) in Oyamazaki, Yamashiro Province, the uo-za (fish guild) in Imamiya, Settsu Province, the zaimoku-za (guild of lumber dealers) in Kamakura; and the yuza (oil guild) in Hakata.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The major za were the orite-za (guild of weavers) in Otoneri, Kyoto, which became the origin of the later Nishijin brocade (high-quality silk fabrics produced in the Nishijin district of Kyoto), the wata-za (cotton guild) and the nishiki-za (brocade guild) which were under the umbrella of the Gion-sha Shrine, the koji-za (rice malt guild) under the Kitano-sha Shrine, the yu-za (oil guild) in Oyamazaki, Yamashiro Province, the uo-za (fish guild) in Imamiya, Settsu Province, the zaimoku-za (guild of lumber dealers) in Kamakura, and the yu-za (oil guild) in Hakata.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 大和国の興福寺や近江国の日吉大社も多数の座を支配下に置いたことで知られていた。
sen.e: The Kofuku-ji Temple in Yamato Province and the Hiyoshi-taisha Shrine in Omi Province were also known to have placed many za under control.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Kofuku-ji Temple in Yamato Province and the Hiyoshi-taisha Shrine in Omi Province were also known to have placed many za under control.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Kofuku-ji Temple in Yamato Province and the Hiyoshi-taisha Shrine in Omi Province were also known to have placed many za under their controls.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 座は仕入の独占を行い、必要に応じてはその商品の運搬路や運送具の独占すら行った。
sen.e: The za monopolized the purchase of goods, and also even the route of transport and the equipment for transport, if necessary.
The za monopolized the purchase of goods, and also even the transport routes and the equipment for transport, if necessary.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: A za monopolized the purchase of goods, and they also even monopolized transport routes for those goods and equipment for transportation, if necessary.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: また、本所の政治力を背景として関所における通行税や市場における営業税の免除の特権を獲得した。
sen.e: Additionally, the za received the privilege of exemptions from the duties at the sekisho (checking station) and business tax in the marketplace with the political support of the honjo.
Additionally, the za received the privilege of exemptions from the duties at the sekisho (checking station) and business tax in the marketplace with the political support of the honjo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Additionally, a za received the privilege of exemptions from tolls at sekisho (checking stations) and business taxes in marketplaces backed up with the political power of their honjo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: その一方で自己の専売を確立した市場では座外の商人・職人の営業を禁止して座衆による独占を図り、座に属する小規模業者の維持に努めた。
sen.e: In the markets where they obtained the exclusive rights to sell their merchandise, at the same time, the za attempted to monopolize the markets by prohibiting merchants and artisans outside the za to engage in trade, and thus sustain small traders belonging to the za.

In the markets where they obtained the exclusive rights to sell their merchandise, at the same time, the za attempted to monopolize the markets by prohibiting merchants and artisans outside the za to engage in trade, and thus sustain small traders belonging to the za.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In the market where a za obtained an exclusive right to sell their merchandise, at the same time, they attempted to monopolize the market by prohibiting merchants and artisans who did not participated in that za from engaging in trade, and thus they sustained small traders belonging to the za.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: また、座同士の連携なども盛んに行われ、生産地の座と消費地の座が連携したり、大都市の座が地方の座を支配したりすることが行われた。
sen.e: The za also actively cooperated with each other; the za in a production site made cooperation with the one in a consumer area, and moreover, the za in a big city controlled the one in a local area.
The za also actively cooperated with each other; the za in a production site made cooperation with the one in a consumer area, and moreover, the za in a big city controlled the one in a local area.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Za also actively cooperated with each other; for example, a za in a production area cooperated with another za in a consumption area, and moreover, a za in a big city controlled another za in a local area.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: だが、室町時代に入ると座を取り巻く環境に変化が生じるようになる。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, however, the environment surrounding the za experienced a gradual change.
In the Muromachi period, however, the environment surrounding the za experienced a gradual change.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, however, the environment surrounding za experienced a gradual change.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 京都における官衙を含めた領主権力が強化され、座の権威を無視して営業税をかけたり、地方の商工業者が地元の領主と結びついて座の権威打破を図ろうとした。
sen.e: The power of the feudal lords in Kyoto including the kanga (government office) was increased, which made it possible for them to impose the business tax without the consent of the za; further, the local merchants and manufacturers tried to destroy the authority of the za in cooperation with local lords.

The power of the feudal lords in Kyoto including the kanga (government office) was increased, which made it possible for them to impose the business tax without the consent of the za; further, the local merchants and manufacturers tried to destroy the authority of the za in cooperation with local lords.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The power of feudal lords including government offices in Kyoto was increased, which made it possible for them to impose business taxes without the consent of za; further, local merchants and manufacturers tried to destroy the authority of za in cooperation with local lords.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: こうした中で座も変質していき、本所から自立した営業集団に転化したり、官衙や領主との結びつきを強めて中にはこれらを新たな本所するものが出現したり、座衆の数を制限して世襲特権化を図ろうとした。
sen.e: Under these circumstances, the za gradually underwent a change; some of the za tried to become trade groups independent from the honjo; another tried to have closer ties to the kanga and feudal lords and at times hold them as their honjo; others attempted to make the za inherited privilege by limiting the number of the za-shu.

Under these circumstances, the za gradually underwent a change; some of the za tried to become trade groups independent from the honjo; another tried to have closer ties to the kanga and feudal lords and at times hold them as their honjo; others attempted to make the za inherited privilege by limiting the number of the za-shu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Under these circumstances, za were also gradually changed. Some za tried to become a trade group independent of their honjo, or some tried to have closer ties to government offices and feudal lords to have them as their honjo, and some attempted to establish a hereditary privilege by limiting the number of members in their za.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: それに対して新興商人側も「新座」と呼ばれる座を結成して既成の座と同様の特権を求める動きが現れ、更に「孫座」と呼ばれる第三の座すら現れる例もあった。
sen.e: To cope with these changes, emerging merchants began to establish the za called 'shin-za' (literally, new za), requesting the same privilege as the existing za, and some of them even formed the third form of the za called 'mago-za' (literally, grandchild's za).

To cope with these changes, emerging merchants began to establish the za called 'shin-za' (literally, new za), requesting the same privilege as the existing za, and some of them even formed the third form of za called 'mago-za' (literally, grandchild's za).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: In order to cope with these changes, emerging merchants began to establish za called 'shin-za' (literally, "new za") for the sake of the same privileges as existing za had, and some of them even formed the third form of za called 'mago-za' (literally, "grandchild's za").
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 織田信長が新都市に楽市・楽座をおこない、最終的に豊臣秀吉によって中世の座は解体させられた。
sen.e: Nobunaga ODA launched the rakuichi-rakuza (free markets and open guilds) in new cities and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ultimately dismantled the za system of the medieval period.
Nobunaga ODA launched the rakuichi-rakuza (free markets and open guilds) in new cities and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ultimately dismantled the za system of the medieval period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Nobunaga ODA launched rakuichi-rakuza (free markets and open guilds) in new cities, and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ultimately dismantled the za system of the medieval period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: これによって座の特定は否認されたが、反対に領主と結びついた特定の御用商人による支配が確立するきっかけとなった。
sen.e: As a result of this, the authority of the za was denied, and this triggered the establishment of control by the specific goyo-shonin (chartered merchants) tied to feudal lords.
As a result of this, the authority of the za was denied, and this triggered the establishment of control by the specific goyo-shonin (chartered merchants) tied to feudal lords.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: As a result of this, privileges of za were denied, but this triggered the establishment of the control of specific goyo-shonin (chartered merchants) tied to feudal lords.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: ただし、全ての座が解体した訳ではなく、座役を伴わない商業共同体として残ったものもある。
sen.e: This was not to say, however, that all za were dismantled, and in fact, some of them remained as commerce associations.
This was not to say, however, that all za were dismantled, and in fact, some of them remained as commerce associations.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This was not to say, however, that all za were dismantled, and in fact some of them remained as commercial communities which did not have to do za-yaku.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: また、芸能者では主要な大夫を家元とする芸能集団としての座が形成され、江戸時代以後に「○○座」という呼称で呼ばれるようになり、転じて劇場や映画館の名称としても用いられた。
sen.e: Additionally, entertainers formed the za as entertainer groups, whose masters were the major tayu (entertainers serving shrines), and those groups came to be called a name plus the suffix '-za' since the Edo period; by further extension, those combined names have been used for theaters and movie theaters.
sen.cmt: daibu (master)→tayu (entertainers serving shrines)[定訳不明]
sen.e: Additionally, entertainers formed the za as entertainer groups, whose masters were the major tayu (entertainers serving shrines), and those groups came to be called a name plus the suffix '-za' since the Edo period; by further extension, those combined names have been used for theaters and movie theaters.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Additionally, entertainers formed some za as entertainer groups whose headmen were major tayu (the headmaster of a school of performing arts), and people began to add the term "za" to the end of their group names beginning in the Edo period. By further extension, such use of "za" also began to be applied to theater names and movie theater names afterward.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 江戸時代には江戸幕府の管理下に金座・銀座 (歴史)などが作られた。
sen.e: During the Edo period, the kin-za (literally, gold za, or gold mint) and the gin-za (literally, silver za, or silver mint) were established under the control of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 原文には、「銀座 (歴史)」 とありますが、「(歴史)」はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「銀座」だけとなっており、本来はこちらの用語だけを使用していると思われますので、こちらだけを訳出しました。
sen.e: During the Edo period, the kin-za (literally, gold za, or gold mint) and the gin-za (literally, silver za, or silver mint) were established under the control of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: During the Edo period, the kin-za (literally, gold za, or gold mint) and the gin-za (literally, silver za, or silver mint) were established under the control of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
